head.title: Vivian Ducat, TV Producer, to Wed

hedline.hl1: Vivian Ducat, TV Producer, to Wed

block.p: Vivian Sophie Ducat, a television documentary producer and writer, and Ray Allen Segal, a photography researcher for museums and television, are engaged to be married in June.

Ms. Ducat, 36 years old, is a magna cum laude graduate of Harvard University and has completed the BBC's Film Directors' Training Course in London. She is a daughter of Josef B. Ducat and Ellen W. Ducat, both of New York. Her father is the president of Interlink Corporation, an import-export company in New York. Her mother, who is a watercolorist, also works as an independent, multi-lingual tour guide in New York.
Vivian Sophie Ducat, a television documentary producer and writer, and Ray Allen Segal, a photography researcher for museums and television, are engaged to be married in June.

Ms. Ducat, 36 years old, is a magna cum laude graduate of Harvard University and has completed the BBC's Film Directors' Training Course in London. She is a daughter of Josef B. Ducat and Ellen W. Ducat, both of New York. Her father is the president of Interlink Corporation, an import-export company in New York. Her mother, who is a watercolorist, also works as an independent, multi-lingual tour guide in New York.

Mr. Segal, 27, graduated from the New School for Social Research. He recently coordinated photography research for an exhibition, sponsored by the American Museum of National History and the Environmental Defense Fund, on global warming. He is a son of Prof. Leon S. Segal and Jane B. Segal of Dayton, Ohio. His father is a retired professor of psychology at Central State University in Wilberforce, Ohio.
